text: English grammar lesson 8 in lesson 7 we
began to talk about reported speech that
is reporting another person's words
telling what someone else said we
learned that reported speech is indirect
speech meaning it doesn't use the exact
words of the speaker so if we don't use
the exact words which words do we use
which words stay the same and which
words change how did they change we'll
begin to understand the answer to these
questions in this lesson lesson 8 as we
talked about the most logical changes
first changes to reference words the
focus of this lesson will be on these
two questions what are reference words
how do we need to change them in
reported speech when I say reference
words I mean words that are used to talk
about a certain person or thing but not
by name let me give you some examples
listen to this statement jennifer has a
spring birthday her birthday is in March
she doesn't like to tell people how old
she is she keeps her age to herself this
statement is about Jennifer the words in
blue her she herself refer back to
Jennifer these words are understood
although we don't mention the person by
name her she herself are examples of
reference words
we just saw that two types of reference
words are pronouns and possessive
adjectives pronouns can answer the
questions who or whom examples of
pronouns are I you me him myself
possessive adjectives can answer the
question whose examples of possessive
adjectives are my your his our when you
begin to change reference words in
reported speech ask these two questions
who is the speaker who is the listener
as the listener you must often change
the speaker's reference words so that
the statement is logical here's an
example of changing pronouns quoted
speech I made the cake myself Leah said
reported speech Leah said that she had
made the cake herself Leah is the
speaker we are the listener so in
reported speech it no longer makes sense
to use I and myself the pronouns changed
to the third person she and herself now
here is an example of changing
possessive adjectives quoted speech the
cake is for my daughter Leah said
reported speech Leah said that the cake
was for her daughter again we are the
listener Leah is the speaker so it makes
sense to change my to her the reported
statement is now logical so my basic
advice is think logically change all the
words you need to change so that the
statement makes sense let's check your
understanding with an exercise
exercise 1 complete the changes for each
reported statement example quoted speech
my birthday is in May said Shannon
reported speech Shannon said that whose
birthday was in May to be logical will
need to change my to her number 1 Tom
said it's my mother's birthday so I'm
taking her out to dinner
now you complete the reported statement
answer tom told us that it was his
mother's birthday so he was taking her
out to dinner to Steve and Lisa said
we'll bring some wine to the party
answer Stephen Lisa said they would
bring some wine to the party 3 I bought
a present for my cousin Tim Anna said
answer Anna said she had bought a
present for her cousin Tim for will buy
you a plane ticket for your birthday
so you can visit us said my grandparents
be careful remember they're your
grandparents answer my grandparents told
me that they would buy me a plane ticket
for my birthday so I could visit them
how did you do
okay so we've talked about changing
pronouns and possessive adjectives
there's another group of reference words
that we need to address those are words
that refer to time in place let's talk
about those now much time can pass
between when words are said and when
words are reported the place where words
are spoken and the place where words are
reported can also be different
that's why reference words for time and
place change in reported speech here are
two examples of changing time words
quoted speech there's a big party
tonight
said Julie now she said these words on
Saturday the reported statement on the
following day Sunday is this Julie said
there was a big party last night
the reported statement a few weeks later
is Julie said there was a big party that
night you need to think logically ask
yourself what is your point of reference
and change the time words appropriately
here's an example of changing place
words quoted speech the party will be
here in my home said Mike as we report
Mike's words we are not in his home
so the reported statement is Mike said
that the party would be there in his
home remember to think logically change
all the words you need to change so that
the statement makes sense the following
is a list of common changes in reported
speech let's first look at time words
today can change to that day yesterday
tomorrow can change to the next day the
following day yesterday can change to
the day before and now can change to
then at that moment or at that time
now here are some common changes with
place words here changes to their this
changes to that these changes to those
in the reverse is also true in quoted
speech there that and those will often
change to here this in these are you
ready for another exercise exercise to
complete the changes for each reported
statement example quoted speech I can
bring the cake there to your house said
Jack now we must report Jack's words the
place is different Jack said they're in
the reported statement we'll use here
Jack said that he could bring the cake
here to my house
now you try number one I will buy
balloons tomorrow said Wendy now you
report her words a week later answer
Wendy said she would buy balloons the
next day to my friends said this
restaurant is a great place to celebrate
your birthday answer my friend said that
restaurant was a great place to
celebrate my birthday three I didn't see
you at the party yesterday marine said
now you report her words a week later
answer Marine said she hadn't seen me at
the party the day before for we need to
get ready now my husband told me
answer my husband told me that we had to
get ready at that moment there's more to
learn about reported speech
I'll have additional lessons on changing
verb tenses reporting questions
reporting commands and using other
reporting verbs so check back soon
additional practice is available at
English cafe calm my user name is
Jennifer ESL the follow-up exercise to
this lesson is now available at English
cafe the direct link to that exercise is
listed in the video description here on
youtube follow the link and I'll see you
there well that's all for now thanks for
watching and happy studies
